titles.title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire property in the town of East Hampton, Suffolk County, New York, for inclusion in the Amagansett National Wildlife Refuge.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior.
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-529.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 259.

action.text: Mr. Longley moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 378.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate.
Amendment SP 3957 proposed by Senator Cohen for Senator Moynihan.
Amendment SP 3957 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: See also S. 1422.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Saxton asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

bill.summary: 5/3/1996--Passed Senate amended. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire specified property in the town of East Hampton, Suffolk County, New York, for inclusion in the Amagansett National Wildlife Refuge. Directs the Secretary to make corrections to a specified map of the Coastal Barrier Resources System relating to Fire Island Unit NY-59P as necessary to: (1) move the eastern boundary of the excluded area covering Ocean Beach, Seaview, Ocean Bay Park, and part of Point O'Woods to the western boundary of the Sunken Forest Preserve; and (2) ensure that the depiction of "otherwise protected areas" does not include any area owned by the Point O'Woods Association, a privately held corporation under the laws of the State of New York.
